metadata.title: CVE-2015-2326 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
The pcre_compile2 function in PCRE before 8.37 allows context-dependentattackers to compile incorrect code and cause a denial of service(out-of-bounds read) via regular expression with a group containing both aforward referencing subroutine call and a recursive back reference, asdemonstrated by "((?+1)(\1))/".

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-2326` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libpcre3 - 1:8.31-2ubuntu2.1
libpcrecpp0 - 1:8.31-2ubuntu2.1
pcregrep - 1:8.31-2ubuntu2.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: pcre3 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:8.31-2ubuntu2.1').
